com.autonomy.aci.client.util

Class DateTimeUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.autonomy.aci.client.util.DateTimeUtils

  • public class DateTimeUtils
extends Object
    This utility class contains methods that are used by some the the APIs processors that need to convert date strings into Date objects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      DateTimeUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static DateTimeUtils getInstance()
        Returns the thread safe singleton instance of this class.
        Returns:
        The thread safe singleton instance of this class

      • parseDate

        public Date parseDate(String string)
               throws ParseException
        Parses a string representing a date, using the pattern dd MMM yy HH:mm:ss and the ENGLISH locale.

        A parse is only deemed successful if it parses the whole of the input string. If the parse pattern didn't match, a ParseException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        string - The date to parse, not null
        Returns:
        The parsed date
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the date string is null
        ParseException - If the date pattern was unsuitable

      • parseDate

        public Date parseDate(String string,
             String format)
               throws ParseException
        Parses a string representing a date, using the supplied pattern and the ENGLISH locale.

        A parse is only deemed successful if it parses the whole of the input string. If the parse pattern didn't match, a ParseException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        string - The date to parse, not null
        format - The date format pattern to use, see SimpleDateFormat, not null
        Returns:
        The parsed date
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the date string is null
        ParseException - If the date pattern was unsuitable

      • parseDate

        public Date parseDate(String string,
             String format,
             Locale locale)
               throws ParseException
        Parses a string representing a date, using the supplied pattern and locale.

        A parse is only deemed successful if it parses the whole of the input string. If the parse pattern didn't match, a ParseException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        string - The date to parse, not null
        format - The date format pattern to use, see SimpleDateFormat, not null
        locale - The locale whose date format symbols should be used
        Returns:
        The parsed date
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the date string or format are null
        ParseException - If the date pattern was unsuitable

      • epochSecondsToDate

        public Date epochSecondsToDate(long epochSeconds)
        ACI Servers generally work in epoch seconds when it comes to durations and times. This method add in milliseconds by multiplying by 1000.
        Parameters:
        epochSeconds - The epoch seconds to convert to a Date
        Returns:
        The epochSeconds with milliseconds added and converted
